comments: A non-plane recursive tree is a rooted labeled plane tree (the children of a node are not ordered) with the property that the labels increase along any path from the root to a leaf. a(n) = the total number of vertices of outdegree 1 among the set of n! non-plane recursive trees on n+1 vertices. An example is given below. - Peter Bala, Jul 08 2012
